alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 6:21PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in southern New Jersey...Burlington. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 621 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. One to 2 inches of rain have fallen for some areas. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Willingboro, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Beverly, Tullytown, Florence-Roebling, Jacksonville, Levittown, Columbus, Edgewater Park, and Fieldsboro. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 6 and 6A. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 358 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 39. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 46 and 56. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
